description.narrative: By 2018, at least 35,000 people, in particular women and children affected by emergencies have adequate access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation and adopt good hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, at least 35,000 people, in particular women and children affected by emergencies have adequate access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation and adopt good hygiene practices.

description.narrative: In 2018, 87,211 people affected by humanitarian situations were reached with safe drinking water and 493,991 people with hygiene promotion messages. As co-lead of the emergency WASH sector UNICEF Burundi continued to improve the coordination of humanitarian preparedness and response. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
% of government-declared emergencies supported by UNICEF
Child-sensitive national risk management plans addressing risks related to WASH in emergencies are in place
